revised_title: Further Observations on the Organization of Fossil Plants of the Coal-Measures: The Roots of Calamites
tldr: This study investigates the roots of Calamites, a type of fossil plant found in coal measures, and provides evidence that these roots were appendages of the stem. The authors analyze the structure and organization of the roots, including their lacunar cortex, absence of nodes, solid pith, and lack of canals accompanying vascular bundles, to establish their morphological nature.
